content.webTitle: Phil Jones a doubt for England's World Cup squad with shoulder injury

fields.headline: Phil Jones a doubt for England's World Cup squad with shoulder injury
fields.bodyText: Phil Jones is a serious doubt for England's World Cup squad because of his shoulder injury, with there being no guarantee Roy Hodgson will be able to select the Manchester United defender when his squad is announced on Monday. Although Ryan Giggs, United's interim manager, suggested Jones would recover in time, his comments are understood to have been optimistic. Jones suffered the problem in a first-half collision with Hull City's Maynor Figueroa in Tuesday evening's 3-1 win at Old Trafford. His shoulder is not dislocated as had been feared – he is thought to have bruised or strained ligaments – and Giggs said at United's pre-match press conference on Friday morning: "Phil's injury isn't as bad as I thought on the night. He is obviously out for Sunday but should be all right for the World Cup." However Jones is by no means certain to recover in time for the tournament. Although Hodgson will wait until the last possible moment to make any decision, if Jones is not passed fit it will affect the make-up of his 23-man party for Brazil. The 22-year-old is viewed by England's manager as vital because of an ability to cover three positions: right-back, centre-back and defensive midfield.
